60852894BE05401FAEF27B29600813F2.description: Investigate the trade qualifier pathway as an alternate pathway to certification in a non-compulsory trade in Saskatchewan.

CCE5F09934C84A4AA6F2D87916E43701.description: Differentiate between compulsory (i.e., construction electrician, plumber, refrigeration and air conditioning mechanic, sheet metal worker and sprinkler fitter) and non-compulsory trades in Saskatchewan.

13519F313A444212B97A5D1BB5CB31AA.description: Explore opportunities and programs that address the issue of underrepresented populations in the trades.

E44B894A701E42799CC21F2B1C8C5DCB.description: Discuss requirements and opportunities for apprentices and journeypersons to train and work in other jurisdictions.

8594AC30D4D541A585D1A5E0D5B2C8A3.description: Research the qualifications needed to obtain Red Seal and Blue Seal certifications.

F249DD17765C45E7A1FDC4A2E185BC65.description: Use appropriate trade-related terminology including: apprentice; journeyperson; indenture; pre-employment training; designated trade and sub-trade; and, advanced standing.

B70C70F656554C848D6934DC2092CFB9.description: Investigate the apprenticeship process in a trade of personal interest.

F57E4DCE1380428D987894DB65DDA0A7.description: Investigate available programs and opportunities such as the Saskatchewan Youth Apprenticeship program and secondary apprenticeship credits that support transitions from high school.

D2E6A70D287742ADB735B772AE2AC4A5.description: Discuss the relationship between the trades and national, provincial and territorial certification bodies including the Saskatchewan Apprenticeship and Trade Certification Commission.

E62A414E68F14A2BB7D81A030F04235D.description: Describe qualities of a successful apprentice.

4228A320581C4BE78E46D7443946BCCA.description: Explore the advantages and disadvantages of apprenticeship for the individual and the trade.

DACF77A2E2F3443C899FFA709A273286.description: Research the history and the role of apprenticeship in the trades.

7DB1F1D473CE414193B9680651CB4E29.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

EF6ED5B939FA4911A1DEA7A6BEA0E9BB.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation

782EF934BE324723BE8E0E7B84CD829A.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

D1EAEE9562A24593A0EC146920AF3488.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals

105F38EC9DD4403781D3F30A232BF6D8.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

5DCB058910914518A2A97D47FB6B91E1.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

A1CD52B0D3AF4527AB71FC0739A84591.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

2625EA43C61040B3846FB7614A82E41C.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

3AB27D1E2EE6409983AA8187D757520B.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

6B73482C99994287AF93C58ED3CBDC50.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

5B87A43C4B4C4767B4F6F47712A1ADDA.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

9C810C2C581C46F394F80AED9B7F7FB3.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

7C3B98A34F004DC5A78770E626D734AC.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

26E4C56AB9774AA381F541CA67DFAC29.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?Who is my supervisor? What should I wear? When will I be provided with safety training? What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement? Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance? What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided? What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace? How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative? Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow? Who is the first aid person? Where are safety notices posted? What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

B4CBC6549B25419BB04DD2E033F7AE2A.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

9C078BF357294E79B686A634F3997C9A.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and,  conflict resolution.

D6DCA6D77341487D843C85C3066C6D06.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement

17F96788ABE646F5A2928DFF40AD2C57.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

86164E8FFB1E4EFF8EFE1764557FDA8A.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

BFA6E827B5124D0CB6B70830E5AA13E9.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

CC7B9560EECA46D6A445AE935D594C1E.description: Identify local examples of automation multi-machine manufacturing.

BD4DEC9E17C34D5DA2D240618EFF7E7D.description: Evaluate the efficiency of various automation processes.

D08E7BD45B874057B7E2DF13855CE1A8.description: Explain how industrial robots are used.

01DA94DECC534DB7AE32D78EF83BD878.description: Describe situations that would utilize automated production systems.

1BB2C37399B5479F8823FEB205CEE03F.description: Discuss what automation means in the machining industry.

8019412153254F6C885C7C8E4DCE2E3E.description: Write a program for a specific workpiece.

745590A4617B4B4F838687F67CD9D292.description: Explore use of graphic simulators on machine tools.

CAF667D39D25420381D16929DDB4BF36.description: Explain canned cycles for drilling, peck-drilling and tapping.

65AE7D16C99749D7AA14E3AE2A1B7B8C.description: Demonstrate basic machining practices on a CNC 3-axis machining center.

A0C8E92E66F04481A86C0C1EFFFE6CF1.description: Characterize work holding fixtures (e.g., hydraulic chucks, tailstocks) in terms of safety and utility.

54FAFCD19CE4489AAE034F300FBBFAB5.description: Explore use of graphic simulators on machine tools.

BB1B61C078F644C48959E6610F32A48E.description: Create a bevel gear using the dividing head on a horizontal mill.

CD59310279EF4C1AA6DC657076A8A970.description: Perform calculations and measurements for a bevel gear.

BDC4027FF75343228A48F09B003A2462.description: Explore the use of a horizontal mill to cut spur and bevel gears.

E7624C624DD04B6082F3D7BB8D63DBD1.description: Observe horizontal milling set ups using form cutters, straddle and gang milling.

A503134B710541598B3E2B88BB15EBD2.description: Explore line boring in horizontal milling machines

20C57B162F034D728A75CAD360A3538C.description: Practice boring in horizontal milling machines.

B122647901DF48988CD020751D90335A.description: Explore practices relevant to setting up large workpieces. (e.g., shimming soft legs, determining and correcting sag in large unsupported sections).

AEBABF4B2EEB4BB18DD975A359EAA8A5.description: Demonstrate safe practices when setting up milling machines.

0E578EC8C9A840D194FE0BEB0B43C645.description: Describe how a vertical milling machine operates.

38B14A7647CF47E19B8D95DEE99B1544.description: Explore the application of different work-holding attachments (e.g., strap clamps, vises, rotary table, dividing head).

985F1754E50045A48B73DA8C7662C3C3.description: Select cutting fluids appropriate for different cutting operations.

4CA2F6B5F55F46AEAA3353E744372BE5.description: Calculate cutting speeds and feed rates for a variety of materials.

0743369A7F664166974F06CBD41BDC64.description: Explore the rationale for different cutting speeds and feeds.

7373CC16427A459FB55B39EA49491AC8.description: Demonstrate safe and effective use of tool holders such as collet chucks, end mill holders and shell mill arbors.

66AD04B0DCE240548A448CA236DCB9FD.description: Install a variety of cutters appropriate for various milling machines

4DAD9E1E4A434642BE7E0A1F14B17FA7.description: Demonstrate safe practices when setting up milling machines.

4DA48529FC17479DA7D66E23A756736E.description: Assess class of thread fit using gauges and fasteners.

4AB969AF4C904EFF8720618D5DF06189.description: Calculate thread depth using appropriate formulas

8985DC0F12514B71872FA9F185F30D7A.description: Describe and identify various thread types using gauges (e.g., ACME, 60 Degree V, Multi-start, tapered pipe).

9455070FBC9B42DCB21CD13381BB88BE.description: Demonstrate the cutting of different kinds of threads on the lathe.

2DDA68D0CF1C45AA950F5233C679D44A.description: Cutting Screw Threads on the Lathe (Core)

C87465C634464B25B2C53A48AE1418E6.description: Demonstrate a variety of different cuts between centers.

DCDC06CEE52E4B87813D1A63794F9041.description: Demonstrate safe practices when mounting and using the attachments on the lathe.

41CAE5419D6A4C9793C20121482F40B9.description: Discuss limitations (e.g., boring, parting, speed) of turning between centers.

9D6FD8CE5F594286A704906CEDCFAC41.description: Demonstrate set-up of required components (e.g., face-plate, lathe dog, two centers) of turning between centers.

C4610AF1FA324624B5C5E7059370F3FB.description: Demonstrate turning between centers on the lathe.

F69213041DE240FA92DDFCAE497DF615.description: Create an emergency evacuation plan to safely leave the machine shop.

D71E84DCFCDF4D668F4DDA123478B805.description: Recognize potential hazards presented by tools and equipment in the machine shop

FC1D36E089CC485B9EF9FC9A3948F53C.description: Identify preventative measures to avoid specific accidents common to machining equipment and environments.

3913F01F13794C4A92A95CA4C7C2034F.description: Locate fire extinguishers, eye-wash station and first-aid station in the work environment.

2B6FFAF7F0294D09A97E51AA07124DAA.description: Discuss processes involved in good housekeeping procedures and routines.

79EA881C7C2F4E3CA5D634B01698C01E.description: Demonstrate consistent and effective use of personal protective equipment (PPE)

82B81B5E4F32460D8B9EE8DC54ABA3D2.description: Identify potential safety hazards (e.g., electricity, chemicals, rotating machines, ventilation, noise) in the machining work environment.

D66CAA29926E4BD68F9EE6D1CC453BCD.description: Apply safe work practices in the machine shop.

81ED198AD99B4E59A51D3F6171075981.description: Identify risks and potential safety hazards (e.g., tools on floor, exposed live wires and extension cords).

6BF8AF16129D40829E12998D53602EC1.description: Describe the importance of a clean work area and methods used to maintain a clean work area

F8129E0E84044249A218969303EFF4F9.description: Identify hazardous materials and relevant Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) procedures.

3D89E06BABA64D60B14F1A25F067ED17.description: Explain the purpose of ventilation in a confined environment.

BD1ED860B3C746559BB9C9119F38774E.description: Discuss appropriate actions in case of an injury or accident, such as whom to contact and first-aid procedures

3A97D38F1A004B33A290FE38F133BE71.description: Describe ways to reduce personal injury or material and equipment damage as a result of unsafe work practices or environments.

1A9D0A2B7CFE4840B9B2AB10E2EB6CA9.description: Review the fire evacuation plan for the work practices including the location of fire alarms, fire extinguishers and exits.

591BF491926A4873A54DC6D138E4D71B.description: Identify industry standard personal protective equipment (PPE) such as safety goggles, footwear, hearing protection, headwear and protective clothing.

6D8D8E55486F4AE3BE2E9823FAC45EA7.description: Recognize and apply safe and fair work practices including freedom from violence, harassment and bullying.

19859877A2B9473185732AFBA0E34D00.description: Apply principles and techniques for injury prevention to ensure safety in the work area.
